newsitem.title: POLAND: PBR to issue $75 mln Eurobond by mid-Nov. [Corrected 11:54 gmt]
newsitem.headline: PBR to issue $75 mln Eurobond by mid-Nov. [Corrected 11:54 gmt]

text.p: (Corrects value of issue in headline and text from $70m)
The Polish Development Bank (PBR) will issue up to $75 million three-year Eurobond and place them privately by mid-November, the bank's president Mieczyslaw Groszek said on Wednesday.
The issue, of between $50 million and $75 million, will be led by CS First Boston, Groszek told a news conference.
"Our shareholders and board agreed that the issue be placed by mid-November," he said. "We have chosen a manager of the issue, which is CS First Boston," he added.
Groszek said the issue would help shift the financing of its foreign currency credits to longer-term and boost credit action.
"Our decision on the Eurobond issue stems from our needs and a good climate on the capital market," he said.
The exact scope of the issue will be determined a week before the placement, Groszek said.

PBR's issue will be the third Eurobond placement by a Polish bank after Poland returned to international finance markets last year with a $250 million issue following debt rescheduling deals with its creditors.
Poland's rating by Moody's Investor Service is now Baa3, while that of Standard and Poor's -- BB.
Earlier this year, state-owned Bank Handlowy SA and Bank Rozwoju Eksportu SA issued three-year Eurobonds of $100 million and $50 million respectively.
BRE is due to decide on another Eurobond issue of $100 million in September.
